message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the problem of achieving invariance to large rotations in natural images using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) and Bayesian Optimization. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also introduces a new convolutional template layer, which is a novel architecture modification, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another likely sub-category. The use of Bayesian Optimization for image retrieval makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) another possible sub-category. The paper is inspired by the neuro-scientific concept of mental rotation, which falls under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper discusses the task-agnostic nature of the proposed method, which can be used as a pre-processing step in any computer vision system, making cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) another possible sub-category.
